segments.text: It's a lovely day out today , isn't it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's beautiful . Enjoy it while it lasts . It's supposed to get cold tomorrow .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What's the weather forecast for tomorrow ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's supposed to snow early tomorrow morning and then tomorrow afternoon there's a chance of freezing rain .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you have any plans for tomorrow ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I was going to drive to Birmingham to see some friends .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You might want to change your plans . With the cold and wet weather that we're supposed to have tomorrow , the roads are going to be rather slippery .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I suppose I should . I don't like driving in dangerous weather conditions . Do you have any plans for tomorrow ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I just have to go to class tomorrow afternoon .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If you're lucky , it'll get cancelled and you can have a snow day !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If that happens , then I'll invite you over and we can drink hot cocoa and watch movies .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Hey , look outside ! It's started to drizzle !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: English weather is even more predictable than I had previously thought .
segments.speaker: S1
